Layer.onHitTest

Function/Meaning
Hit Test
Type
Layer class event
Syntax
onHitTest(x, y, hit)
Arguments
x The x-coordinate (within the layer's display coordinates) of the position to perform the hit test.
y The y-coordinate (within the layer's display coordinates) of the position to perform the hit test.
hit The result of the hit test; true if hit, false if not. Pass the hit test result to this argument of the superclass event of the same name.
Description
Called when a hit test is performed on a point within the layer.
Pass the hit test result to the third argument of this event in the superclass (pass the first and second arguments as they are).
If the hit test result is a hit, mouse messages become opaque and are processed by that layer.
If it is not a hit, it becomes transparent, and mouse messages are processed by layers further back.
This event is called after a "hit" determination is made by the hit test performed via Layer.hitThreshold or Layer.hitType. Therefore, if Layer.hitThreshold or Layer.hitType determines it is "not a hit", this event will not be called.
